definition: name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people

sentences.english: I give the Latin on account of the savoriness of the trivial name.
sentences.chinese: 我把它的拉丁文的學名寫下是因爲它的俗名不很好。

sentences.english: The common name of H2O is water, its systematic name is dihydrogen oxide.
sentences.chinese: H2O的俗名是水，其系統命名是氧化二氫。

sentences.english: Fish and Parcels is the slang name for the District Line .
sentences.chinese: 地區線的俗名是“魚和小包裹”。

definition: scientific name/Latin name (of plant or animal)/(according to an old system of nomenclature) on entering school life, a formal personal name given to new students
also known as/alternative name/to also be called
also known as/alternative name/to also be called
to be generally referred to (as)/generic term
... hence the name (used at the end of a sentence)
old term/old way of referring to sth
name in religion (of Buddhist or Daoist within monastery)
